text:
Hey guys it’s Ro! Welcome to another Nerdy
Nummies!

I got so many requests from you guys to make
something else Pokemon related,
and I’m OK with that because, I love Pokemon!
So today, we are gonna be making Moomoo Milkshakes!
Let’s get started!

Also, side note, my friend’s Kurt Hugo Schneider
and Husky Starcraft made a

I love Pokemon song, and I’ve been listening
to it like crazy!

I’m gonna be playing it throughout this
episode, and I’ll put links to it

down below, if you love it as much as I do
you can go check it out.

The things you will need to make these Moomoo
Milkshakes, will be:

A blender, and some cherries, you can use
Maraschino or some fresh cherries.

Ice cream scoop, whipped cream, vanilla ice
cream, 2 cups of milk, you can use

whatever kind you’d like, 6 tablespoons
of sugar, and 1 tablespoon of vanilla extract.

You’re also gonna need these glass milk
jars, I found these at Michael’s craft store,

I’ll put a link down below, but you can
also find them a ton of other places.

Some white printable sticker paper, scissors,
and some milkshake straws!
Now let’s put it all together!

The first thing that we’re gonna do is a
little arts and crafts, we’re gonna

decorate our Moomoo Milkshake bottle, I made
this template in photoshop, I’ll put
a link down below so you can go download it.
Or you can make your own, whatever you like.

Once you have your design you’re gonna print
it out on your sticker paper,
and then cut it out!

Once you’ve got all your little Moomoo Milkshake
labels cut out, now we are

gonna stick them on the side of the jar, to
decorate!

So you’re just gonna peel off the back,
because it’s like a sticker, roop!
And then stick it on the smooth side!

Now we’re gonna set these jars off to the
side and we’re gonna mix up our milkshake!

My milkshake brings the… Bulbasaurs to the
yard… And they’re like…
Feed me!
Mer-wah-wah-wah-wah-wah-wah-wah!
Alright, now we’re gonna mix it all up!

The first thing that we’re gonna do is,
we’re gonna add 4 cups of ice cream

into the blender. my blender has these little
measure marks, 1, 2, 3, 4.

So I’m just gonna fill it to the number
4 line. Now we’re gonna add the milk,
roooop!

And a little extra vanilla. Put on the lid
and then you’re gonna blend it up.
Ahhhhhhh!

“I Love Pokemon! Raise your glass of Moomoo
Milk for Pokemon!”

“I Love Pokemon! Everybody give it up for
Pokemon!”

Now for the fun part, we are gonna assemble
our milkshakes.

I love this recipe because you can customize
it however you like.

You can throw in fresh fruit, you can make
Pineapple milkshakes, or coconut
milkshakes, whatever you like.

Use your little funnel, put him like that,
makes it a little easier.
Oh yummy, yummy, yummy! Milkshake in my tummy!

Oh shoot, that might have been too much now,
uh-oh, uh-oh, uh-oh, uh-oh!
Mmmmmmm! Mistakes are delicious!

Whipped cream is totally optional, I just
love it, so I always
like to add it on milkshakes.
Weeeee-ooooo! Oh so cute!

Wouldn’t be complete without a little cherry
on top, boop!
And a milkshake straw!
Da-da!
Here are the Pokemon Themed Moomoo Milkshakes!

I hope you guys enjoyed these, they’re a
really good summertime treat,
and they are super easy mode.

I’ll be taking lots of pictures and posting
these on Facebook, Tumblr, Instagram

and Twitter! And if you guys make these, please
take a picture and send it

to me, I love seeing your baking creations,
it just sort of like, makes my day!

And, if you have any other ideas for any other
Nerdy Nummies, please let me know,

leave me a comment down below and I will do
my best to make it happen!

Also, quick reminder, I put a link down there
to the song “I love Pokemon”

I think the song is awesome and if you want
to go check it out, please do so!
Alright, thanks you guys, bye-bye!

“I Love Pokemon! Raise your glass of Moomoo
Milk for Pokemon!”

“I Love Pokemon! Everybody give it up for
Pokemon!”

“Squirtle, Bulbasaur, Caterpie, Pikachu,
wherever we go, I will never leave you!”

“Charizard, Butterfree, Tangen, Snorlax,
when we’re in battle, I got your back!”

“Catch ‘em all, that’s my objective,
every move I make is super effective!”
